column5: Hi,  Was wondering if anyone could recommend a public launch on Lake of Bays.   Preference would be near Baysville, but doesn't really matter.  Thanks!
There are boat launches on The Lake of Bays @ Baysville-Dorset-Dwight, just pick the town where you want to boat from - all have easy access & parking....

Hey I live in Baysville  the launch at the marina on North road is owned by the township and is a public free launch trailer parking is located 30 seconds away by the tennis courts.  There is also one about 10 km up the road on old HWY 117 beside the Bigwin Island docks.  Good luck    ian
Thanks for the info!  How is the launch on South Portage Road??
Hi there, we have a cottage on Lake of Bays and the South Portage launch is excellent. We use that launch for all our boats.  It is a bit of a boat ride to Baysville

I've been to a launch at south portage rd in the winter.  Seemed like limited parking to me?  The local guys might be able to confirm that.  I use the launch near Dorset off 35.  It was great.  Tons of parking.  Google calls it Rabbit Bay.

I think there are two launches on South Portage Road, but I've only been there for ice fishing.  I believe there is a launch on Portage Bay that is somewhat small, but I believe there is another one closer to Baysville in Lake of the Bays Park??? Can't find much information about this park at all.  It doesn't need to be that close to Baysville, was just planning on fishing the "southern arm" of the lake in general - probably around Whitehouse Bay.  Thanks again!

Here's some info on public and private marine facilities around Lake of Bays.   According to this, the South Portage launch is at 4066 South Portage Road.  I believe that the only launch in Baysville is at Baysville Marina.  http://media.cottagecountrynow.ca/special/muskokasun/data/pdfs/73/A16.pdf
Thanks for the document Wallacio!   Turns out the launch I was trying to find is actually one of the access points I used ice fishing last season.   Sometimes it's hard to tell in the winter.

if fishing Whitehouse bay you want to use the launch at the town of Huntsville Dock . . It is located on South Portage Road however there is only enough parking for maybe 4 trailers.  From BaYsville launch it would be 10 min boat ride max to Whitehouse bay.  There is also another launch on the Dwight end of South Portage and a launch on Dwight beach road in Dwight    Ian
